data.title: VolumetricFog memory leak fix
data.body: Fixes a memory leak on clients and prevents a crash from deleting a RTT target while it's still registered with the GFX device.

data.title: Why not apply Camera FX on vehicle driver position?
Fix for bug #1975
data.body: The change was made to the function that is executed when entering the world editor. The boolean variable for first person shooter was set to true, since the camera always defaults to first person on entering the world editor. On setting this boolean variable to be true, the correct camera setting will always be displayed on entering the world editor. This does not affect other camera labels.

data.title: Weapon blur being applied to 3rd person view
data.body:
Issue:    While playing the game, there is a feature that blurs the gun when in the zoomed mode. This is supposed to provide a field of view perspective to make it look more realistic. Apart from the fact that it is kind of finicky and only works sometimes, it is also applied when it shouldn't be. 
When you are in the 3rd person camera angle and zoom in using the right mouse button, your character will be blurred. This looks awful and does not provide any benefits.

Proposed fix:   

 (1) Remove the applied blurring effect when in the 3rd person camera angle
                                                                                         or
                         (2) Disable the zoom feature while in 3rd person
                                                                                         or
                         (3) Have the zoom button change to first person and zoomed while the right mouse button is held down. This would provide the most functionality.

This is how the effect looks while in 1st person. (Actually boosts realism)
![blur 1st person](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/25248660/25504892/8dcb4f76-2b6d-11e7-8f1f-22868a00bf77.png)

This is how the effect looks while in 3rd person. (Degrades view and looks bad)
![blur 3rd person](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/25248660/25504937/c0cf633a-2b6d-11e7-97e8-ee3736f6f68d.png)

data.title: No crosshair while in "zoomed" mode
data.body:
Issue:   When playing the game either in the User Interface or in the World Editor, when zooming in (right mouse button) the crosshair goes away. The purpose of zooming in for a first person shooter is to get a more accurate shot. By removing the crosshair you lose accuracy, thus deeming the zoom feature pointless. 

Recommended Fix:   Implement a crosshair when in zoomed view.

![crosshairs](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/25248660/25504526/3ad1bf36-2b6c-11e7-9fa1-3318dd7a3b5e.PNG)
Before being zoomed (See crosshair)

![no crosshairs](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/25248660/25504571/5e6c0d20-2b6c-11e7-90d0-73ddb11f8e97.png)
After being zoomed (No crosshair)

data.title: Cannot edit multiple objects
data.body:
I remember being able to select and edit the values of multiple objects before in Torque, but it seems to be broken now.
To reproduce: Place multiple objects in the default template, like some rocks, select them all and edit some values like scale and you will notice it will only update the item you selected last.

You really should be able to select and edit multiple objects at once, imaging having placed hundreds of objects and in the end you realize you have to switch collision type to visible mesh or something like that on all of them and it would be just insane to select each one separately and change the value and then repeat it a hundred times, when you just could select all and change it and done.

data.title: Checking Torque3D with PVS-Studio static analyzer
data.body:
Hello, I have found and fixed some bugs using PVS-Studio tool. PVS-Studio is a static code analyzer for C, C++ and C#: https://www.viva64.com/en/pvs-studio/ Analyzer warnings: * [V591](https://www.viva64.com/en/w/V591/) Non-void function should return a value. [Engine/source/core/util/tSignal.h 165](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/blob/development/Engine/source/core/util/tSignal.h#L165) _Comment_: If there is needed to prevent the copying of the object, then there is no need to provide the definition of the copy constructor and the assignment operator, because the member functions and `friend` functions can still call them. _Note_: If the code is compiled by a compiler with support for the C++11 standard, you can delete them using the keyword `delete` like this: 
....
  public:
    SignalSlot( const SignalSlot&) = delete;
    SignalSlot& operator=( const SignalSlot&) = delete;
  ....
* [V547](https://www.viva64.com/en/w/V547/) Expression 'bytesRead < 0' is always false. Unsigned type value is never < 0. [Engine/source/sfx/media/sfxVorbisStream.cpp 217](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/blob/development/Engine/source/sfx/media/sfxVorbisStream.cpp#L217) _Comment_: The variable `bytesRead` of type `unsigned int` stores the result of the `ov_read` function, which returns a signed value (`long`). Comparison `bytesRead < 0` does not make sense. * [V547](https://www.viva64.com/en/w/V547/) Expression 'path == ""' is always false. To compare strings you should use strcmp() function. [Engine/source/console/consoleFunctions.cpp 2151](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/blob/development/Engine/source/console/consoleFunctions.cpp#L2151) _Comment_: The comparison `path == ""` will not be as expected. To compare a C-string to an empty string, either use the `strcmp` function, or compare the first byte of the string with the null-terminal character. * [V610](https://www.viva64.com/en/w/V610/) Undefined behavior. Check the shift operator '<<'. The left operand '~mask' is negative. [Engine/source/core/strings/unicode.cpp 472](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/blob/development/Engine/source/core/strings/unicode.cpp#L472) _Comment_: In an arithmetic expression, all the variables whose values can be represented with type `int` will be promoted to this type. Therefore, the variable `mask` will be promoted to the `int` type and the result of the `~mask` expression will be a negative number. By the C++ standard, shifting a negative number to the left leads to an undefined behavior. * [V570](https://www.viva64.com/en/w/V570/) The 'box' variable is assigned to itself. [Engine/source/forest/forestCollision.h 61](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/blob/development/Engine/source/forest/forestCollision.h#L61) _Comment_: When copying a `cv` object, its `cv.box` field was not copied. In addition, I suggest having a look at the emails, sent from @pvs-studio.com. Best regards, Phillip Khandeliants

data.title: Drag coefficient misspelled
data.body:
This addresses issue #1501 
The property variable "dragCoefficient" was misspelled in various datablocks in the grenadeFX.cs and rocketFX.cs files, both in the Templates directory locations and the Modules directory locations.  It was misspelled as "dragCoeffiecient", as noted in the issue ticket.  Some but not all of those locations were spelled correct, but the property was misspelled in numerous other locations in those two files as well.  This corrects the spelling of those properties so that users trying to reference those properties in other parts of the Torquescript will be able to reference them by the correct name.  
For instance, if one had a list of datablocks that included some where the property was spelled correctly and some where it was spelled incorrectly, and wanted to iterate through that list, changing the "dragCoefficient"property for each, they would get an error as some of the datablocks would not have the "dragCoefficient" property, as it was misspelled in them.
This also makes it more intuitive for users to reference that property in other parts of Torquescript even when referencing it for a single datablock as they now do not need to know that the property is misspelled, and how it is misspelled.

data.title: Fixed old names of decal properties
data.body:
Renamed the screenStartRadius and screenEndRadius properties in the bulletHoleDecal datablock and ScorchRXDecal datablock to fadeStartPixelSize and fadeEndPixelSize properties, respectively, to match names of the properties as defined in the decalData.cpp file, as noted in issue #1498
Among other possible fixes, this makes the size of the bullet hole decal's actually random in size now, instead of always being the exact same size.

data.title: Ai turret ignore list functions
data.body:
Implements feature(s) requested in issue #1272 
The first feature is exposing a function to Torquescript that allows retrieving the count of the total number of objects on a turret's ai ignore list, ignoreListCount().

The second feature is exposing a function to Torquescript that allows retrieving a reference to an object on an AI turret's ignore list based off of the index in the list of that object, rather than the object's ID (so the object's ID does not have to be known beforehand).  The feature request issue #1272 requests for this feature to return the object's ID but then shows an example modifying the object directly (increasing the health of the object by 10), so to fulfill the requested functionality based on the example, this feature returns a reference to the object itself so that properties can be called and modified on the object directly, as shown in the example on the feature request.

data.title: Ai turret clear ignore list
data.body:
Implements feature requested in issue #1271 
Exposes the ability to clear the entire ai turret ignore list to Torquescript with the function clearIgnoreList()

data.title: Better Alt+C Camera Toggle Bug #1943 Fix
data.body: Moved the Alt+C binding from Templates/Full/game/scripts/server/components/game/camera.cs to worldEditor.ed.cs. Alt+C should only be accessible to the world editor and not the user interface.

data.title: Better bug fix for #1738 (str.cpp)
data.body: Fixes #1738 without redundant checks. Because of the while loop on line 1616 giving the variable p its value, the check against base is redundant.

data.title: Alt+C Camera Toggle Bug Fix
data.body:
Resolves #1943 
Removed the leftover line of code changing the keybind of the alt+c keyboard command that was supposed to have been moved to a new location, but was not. In the new location, the keyboard command alt+c is bound to a different function that properly toggles the camera as alt+c should.

data.title: Potential fix for bug #1975
data.body: The change was made to the function that is executed when entering the world editor. The boolean variable for first person shooter was set to true, since the camera always defaults to first person on entering the world editor. On setting this boolean variable to be true, the correct camera setting will always be displayed on entering the world editor. This does not affect other camera labels.

data.title: [Feature Request] UWP support for Xbox Creator Program
data.body:
Got a bit of a feature request,
Would it be possible to add the Universal Windows Platform as a target platform?

Why I am asking -
Microsoft recently announced the [Xbox Creators Program](https://developer.microsoft.com/en-us/games/xbox/xboxlive/creator). This program will take advantage of their UWP ecosystem that they are trying to build.

data.title: Reordering initialization methods #1912
data.body: Fixes for for #1912 and #1805

data.title: Fix for bug #1738
data.body: getTrailingNumber("string") and stripTrailingNumber("string") will now work for single letter cases. For example, getTrailingNumber() will return "11" if the input is "a11" or "t11", and stripTrailingNumber() will return "a" if the input is "a11".

data.title: Added gui functionality for vehicle re-mapping as per #950
data.body:
Added vehicle re-mapping functionality for the vehicle movements (forward, backward, brake).
Essentially just added a branched functionality if re-mapped functionality is vehicular without affecting the original functionality. Please let me know if there is anything to change.

data.title: Possible fix to issue #1951
data.body:
[BugFixanalysisforissue1951.docx](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/files/914377/BugFixanalysisforissue1951.docx)

When two instances of Torque3D are running on the same network, one as a
hosted server and the other as a client, the client is unable to connect
to the server. The program now can open a socket. This was obviously a
typo. To find the error I just searched for keywords containing socket,
open, open socket, and opensocket till I found the correct file. The
other error was in how the program processed non fatal errors. I just
outputed the error to the main console and devised that the socket
should not be closed for a WSAEWOULDBLOCK error 10035 "It is normal for
WSAEWOULDBLOCK to be reported as the result from calling connect on a
nonblocking SOCK_STREAM socket, since some time must elapse for the
connection to be established."

Read about the WouldBlock error:

https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/ms740668(v=vs.85).aspx

Use of dbgSetParameters ( port , password ):

http://docs.garagegames.com/tge/official/content/documentation/Reference/Console%20Functions/TorqueScript_Console_Functions_2.html#dbgSetParameters_.28_port_.2C_password_.29

Lines:  812, 829-837

data.title: Replaces uses of 'Prepass' with 'Deferred'
data.body: Goes and replaces the references/names that use Prepass to be Deferred, since we're actually using deferred.

data.title: adds profiling to the various gbitmap loaders*
data.body: *note, DDS bypasses the gbitmap method chain in question.

data.title: Removes bits of code and includes that are based on old console flags
data.body: Removes bits of code and includes that are based on old 360, xbox and PS3 flags that are no longer needed.

data.title: Fix for issue #1951 & #1975
data.body:
#1951 : 
When two instances of Torque3D are running on the same network, one as a
hosted server and the other as a client, the client is unable to connect
to the server. The program now can open a socket. This was obviously a
typo. To find the error I just searched for keywords containing socket,
open, open socket, and opensocket till I found the correct file. The
other error was in how the program processed non fatal errors. I just
outputed the error to the main console and devised that the socket
should not be closed for a WSAEWOULDBLOCK error 10035 "It is normal for
WSAEWOULDBLOCK to be reported as the result from calling connect on a
nonblocking SOCK_STREAM socket, since some time must elapse for the
connection to be established."

Read about the WouldBlock error:

https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/ms740668(v=vs.85).aspx

Use of dbgSetParameters ( port , password ):

http://docs.garagegames.com/tge/official/content/documentation/Reference/Console%20Functions/TorqueScript_Console_Functions_2.html#dbgSetParameters_.28_port_.2C_password_.29

#1975 : 
The change was made to the function that is executed when entering the world editor. The boolean variable for first person shooter was set to true, since the camera always defaults to first person on entering the world editor. On setting this boolean variable to be true, the correct camera setting will always be displayed on entering the world editor.
[Milestone 6.docx](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/files/907191/Milestone.6.docx)

data.title: Camera label does not match camera option in WorldEditor
data.body:
At the right bottom corner in WorldEditor, there is an option to change the camera settings. So, when you change it to 3rd person shooter and close the worldEditor, the moment you reopen the WorldEditor the label of the camera setting is set to 3rd person shooter and the camera is in 1st person shooter.

Steps to replicate the bug:
1. Open WorldEditor
2. Camera setting is on First Person Shooter"
3. Change camera settings to Third Person Shooter (Label changes and the camera changes)
4. Exit WorldEditor
5. Reopen WorldEditor (Label is set to Third Person Shooter while the camera goes back to First Person Shooter )

![17693123_1691340340891124_975157578_o](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/25381649/24737574/cf36ceac-1a5d-11e7-8cb5-c8095fb8e309.png)
